Reviews.Title: Easy to Use Functional Camera
Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: The camera works fine for me.  I bought the camera at a local department store before reading the reviews.  The camera was on sale for $20 and so far I'm happy with it.  I needed an inexpensive camera that was easy to carry in my shirt pocket and that I didn't have to worry too much about being so careful with it.  I needed it for documentation of apartment repairs, tenant isssues and general photo taking.  I have a $200 Samsung that I was always worrying about bumping it, dropping it and being careful where I set it.The Pros:  After reading all the negative reviews, I tested the Vivitar 7022 in just about every mode it offered with no adverse problems.  Picture quality was good, video quality was pretty good, it has almost all the features as my $200 Samsung does, except optical zoom.  The 4x digital zoom was a little grainy but acceptable for the type of photos I will take.  The Macro mode was good at taking pics of printed documents.  The on-screen icons can be easily turned off but you will need the owners manual to reveal these fetures.  It turns on quickly and is ready to use in just a few seconds as compared to my Samsung which has a longer boot time.  I'm only using a 512 MB SD Card and with about 100 pics and 4 videos, all taken with the highest quality image settings, it still had about half the memory left on the card.The Cons:  It does deplete alkaline batteries quickly using the flash.  I bought a set of 900 mAH NiMH rechargeable AAA Hi-Capacity batteries for about $8 and I got over 80 flash pics, about 4 short videos and spending a lot of time going through each mode changing settings and experimenting and still didn't deplete the batteries.  If you buy rechargeable batteries,  get the 900 or higher mAh rated NiMH batteries, I used some 350 mAh Ni-CAD rechargeables that I had and only got about 3 dozen pics w/flash.  The view screen is small and a bit grainy.  In the outdoor sunlight the view screen is difficult to see the image your taking a picture of.  The view screen should be brighter since there is no view finder to look through in such situations.  The Date/Time setting is lost when the batteries are removed even for a shot time but all other customize setting remain.  Except for the flash setting, it goes to the default setting (OFF) each time the camera is powered off.  There is no shutter cover.The Software:  I already have several photo editing programs and didn't need to install another one from Vivitar.  I did explore its contents to access the owners manual, but it was not available without installing the software.  So I went to Vivitar's website and downloaded the manual.  I have no problems transferring the pics to my computer without the software.

Reviews.Title: Vivitar 7022 - Very nice camera...
Reviews.Author: Louis Ensten
Reviews.Content: Ok, I read all the negative links and was amazed at the comments.. You would think this is a devil's device from Hell.. Wrong, wrong, wrong... But, I know what is the problem.. This little guy, unlike the throw-a-ways, is just too  complicated for the average user to comprehend without studying and practice.. Vivitar has incorporated most of the features of their higher end models.. How do you work the camera?? Read the owner's manual.. Woops, what owners manual?? It's on the CD disk.. Oh, but I don't want their software, so who needs the disk?? Catch 22.. Solution, download the owners manual from Vivitar's website (many PDF pages).. My camera takes GREAT still AND shake proof videos.. Very sharp and clear, if you setup the proper mode of focus.. Use lithium aaa batteries for many hundreds of pictures... Yes, there are lots of features I haven't used, yet.. After setting up the basic camera, I have been using the default mode.. Works like a charm... Don't be afraid of this guy because of the low price.. It is very sturdy and feels like quality...

Reviews.Title: Pretty Good -- NOT GREAT!!!
Reviews.Author: Timewarpone
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my 11-1/2 y/o daughter. She loves it and it keeps her out of my hair from wanting to use our more expensive($200)camera. The price was cheap enough so I don't have to worry about her losing it. Easy enough for her to use. Comes with a wrist strap, install CD-Rom and USB sync cord if you want to sync your camera to your computer without removing the SD Card. A SD Card is required but NOT included. (I bought a 1gb SD Card for $5.00) She had some questions at first, which of course I helped her with. She loves the sync feature with Facebook. The AAA batteries don't last very long (Especially when you use the flash) so I bought some rechargeable AAA Sanyo eneloop batteries which can be charged 1500 times. The photo quality is very acceptable for a child who is not as critical as an adult. Even she noticed how much better the quality was over her Nintendo DS. My real complaint/s is a small viewing screen that has way to many icons and the battery door is to difficult for her to open. Another flaw is that whenever you turn the camera on and the camera is pre-set to "AUTO" exposure, the default flash setting is preset to "OFF" or no flash. This means that you have to choose the flash option desired every time you turn the camera on, it can not be pre-set. If the flash is needed for indoor shooting then you have to set the flash option to AUTO or DEDICATED or RED EYE. IF MY CHILD FORGETS TO ACTIVATE THE FLASH FOR INDOOR SHOOTING THEN THE PICS ARE VERY DARK. Also the menus are not that intuitive but like any electronic device sold in the world today there is a learning curve associated with that device. The software is easy to use (Running Windows 7 Ultimate 32bit) but the users manual is a .pdf file so Adobe Reader will be needed to view it. This was a pretty good choice for my daughters first camera. Pretty Good but NOT Great!!!!

Reviews.Title: Inexpensive but good
Reviews.Author: Janie Pennington
Reviews.Content: I liked that this camera was cheap because i was buying it for my young son. I realized after it came though, part of the reason it was so cheap was that it doesnt come with its own sd card. A small problem but on the whole i am pleased.

Reviews.Title: Great gift for 8-15 yrs old
Reviews.Author: jazjogma3
Reviews.Content: I got it for my grand daughter shes a very busy girl .She loved it to take to cheerleading and baseball. It would be great for children 8-15 to take pictures of memories.

Reviews.Title: camera review
Reviews.Author: AB Property
Reviews.Content: Products were shipped promptly and arrived in good condition. Would be good if the original listing had noted that it needed batteries.

Reviews.Title: Just adequate
Reviews.Author: Kedrigern
Reviews.Content: First, I buy cheap cameras.  I use the cameras for work photos and tend to ruin about three to four each year.  The cameras take passable photos but not with the quality expected from the megapixels.  It takes some getting used to the flash being off as default and having to turn it on each time the camera is powered up.  Also the flash recovery between shots is quite slow, in the range of 5 seconds.  A set of rechargeable batteries will take about 60-80 flash photos and then need to be replaced.  Obviously, it will take more photos in natural light.  Overall its OK for photos to be included in a written report, but if the photos are the main emphasis then look for another camera.

Reviews.Title: Cheap, but pictures are horrible quality!
Reviews.Author: ceebee100 "Cory"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my 63 yr old mother who has never had a digital camera before and I wanted something simple and cheap that she could just take pictures and email them to me. It's simple enough that she could work it, but the picture quality is atrocious! They claim it's 7.1MP, but looks more like 1.7MP. Anyway, like they say...you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: Excelent product
Reviews.Author: Hector A. Mayes Flores
Reviews.Content: I really liked this medically, I was successful, the camera is very good, the screen is not the image but the photos if they look good on the computer, fast response, very good presentation

Reviews.Title: Not Very Good
Reviews.Author: John & Amy Griffin
Reviews.Content: I was not happy with this camera. They batteries run low to easily and the pictures are almost always blurry. I love to take videos, but I hardly ever use this feature because the camera can barely pick up sound. This camera is a pathetic dissapointment to Vivitar. I am looking foward to buying a new camera. Please don't buy this one.

Reviews.Title: Oh, my first digital camera
Reviews.Author: Collis Huntington "Hyawatha"
Reviews.Content: The price of the Vivitar 7022 camera and it's 7.1 spec's is what got me to buy this my first digital camera. I took little over a hundred pictures before I had to change the batteries with my first use. The battery compartment is hard to get into to put batteries in, you have to find a tool to open it, but then you will not have to worry about the batteries falling out either. It is a bit dark when using inside without flash. The video mode seems to require fully charged batteries. It took good enough pictures outside for digital camera, a few times it was a bit hazy, but until I use a better camera this camera I rate it as 4 stars. I hope some day to be able to afford a digital camera that takes better pictures of the moon than this Vivitar 7022. My digital camera moon test: the moon looked hazy. Over all, I think it is a good first time digital camera.

Reviews.Title: Better than Most Reviews Indicate
Reviews.Author: Charles S. Tritt
Reviews.Content: This camera is working great for me. I wanted an inexpensive camera to keep in my car in case I ever need it. This camera is fine for this use. It takes very good pictures as long as you use it correctly. It has a two position fixed focus lens. As long as you stay within the specified distances the focus is fine and the images are sharp.

Reviews.Title: Vititar 7022 digital camera
Reviews.Author: Bleak
Reviews.Content: Camera is OK... The picture is grainy and unclear even when preparing to take the picture.  Focusing is hard, and the auto share doesn't seem to work.  I don't like the idea of usiong batteries in a digital camera :-( the cheap camera I use at work has more definition than this one.  Definately wil not by this type again especially for $40+ dollars!

Reviews.Title: Good Camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Dee Hassan
Reviews.Content: Great camera for a low price....it came with USB cord, memory card, dvd (tutorial)....I love it..very compact & cute....the size of a cell phone...perfect!

Reviews.Title: A true embarrassment for Vivitar
Reviews.Author: Alexander Aron Flig
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera from a brick-&-mortar store.  It went right back with the words "There is nothing wrong with it other than that it exists."  It is rare for me to describe something with such explicit disgust.The packaging is pretty.  That's its only good feature.  The body feels like something one would buy at a Tijuana street merchant with the brand name "Roleks".  The shooting is delayed as if on timer--FOR EVERY SHOT, IRRESPECTIVE OF LIGHTING.  But the final--and truly only real--test of any camera is its picture quality.  This camera's 7.1 MP photographs rival the VGA resolution photographs of the earliest camera phones.  I'm really not kidding--its that bad.  How any manufacturer could achieve such poor picture quality from such a high pixel count is difficult to conceive;  I mean you really have to try to make it that bad.  Really, Vivitar, how could you do this to yourself???

Reviews.Title: Cheap Throwaway Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Starfaz
Reviews.Content: I didn't want to take my Canon SureShot kayaking, fearing I would drop it in the Pacific Ocean.  So, I bought the Vivitar 7022 at Walmart.  It was cheap enough so if I lost it, it wouldn't matter.  It worked for what I needed it for.  The pictures are grainy, the colors are off and I seriously doubt it being anywhere close to a 7.1 megapixel camera (other than the specs).  It will drain a set of 3 x AAA batteries after about 30 shots or 30 minutes of AVI video.  The menus are difficult to understand and use.  If you want a camera to give to your young children to play with, this is it.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't come with storage
Reviews.Author: Kristina Zabala "NWKristina"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera "new in package".  It doesn't come with smart card storage.  You can only take one photo and must delete or download it before you can take another.  Nothing in the ad or on the package says this.  VERY disappointing gift to give someone when it doesn't work when you get it.

Reviews.Title: Gift for Grandson.
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey J. Bourgeois
Reviews.Content: Purchased as Christmas gift for Grandson. His Mom said it is perfect, as she had bought the same for her daughter earlier.

Reviews.Title: Cheap
Reviews.Author: Gary A. Olson
Reviews.Content: Low end camera. I bought this for my wife. She needed something easy and small so this will fit in her purse. The pictures are fair.

Reviews.Title: Small but mighty
Reviews.Author: Patricia A. Ashley "Hooked"
Reviews.Content: This small camera takes very beautiful pics and I love it. Use it at my family reunion and the pics are full colored and better than some larger camera that I have used.

Reviews.Title: junk
Reviews.Author: groom
Reviews.Content: this camera isnt worth ten dollars..what a peace of junk.....worked with it for 4 days ...no luck...on sharp imiages you couldnt even read the date on the pic....what a waste of money.......

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: C. M. Barnes "RockDoggy"
Reviews.Content: The photo quality is poor, and it doesn't work with my Eye-Fi cards. If I had paid more, I would make it a one star review, but I can't say I had high expectations. My 9 year old now occasionally uses this camera.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy this camera!
Reviews.Author: Scott Havice
Reviews.Content: If this is typical of what Vivitar thinks is a good digital camera, I can tell you I will never consider buying their brand...EVER.This camera was a door prize I won and I can tell you that had it been purchased, I would have returned it.  The display image is very poor.  Even at its highest megapixel settings, you get very poor pictures.  Don't think you will get anything worth showing to anyone else unless you are in very bright light or are using the flash.As this was a freebie, I think I will store it in the glove box of my car...for any emergency picture taking (and even then, I think I will get better pics from my cell phone).

Reviews.Title: Vivicam is rubbish.
Reviews.Author: S. Keeter
Reviews.Content: The picture of the camera makes it look so much better than it actually is; the camera is just a piece of junk. It's flimsy and seems poorly made - the screen is static-y and the zoom is rubbish. I guess I was expecting something better, as I've had other vivitar cameras in the past that have been pretty decent for the price. I would have sent the camera back, but I was too lazy... now it's probably destined to sit in its box beneath my bed.

Reviews.Title: Ok for certain uses
Reviews.Author: Jenn
Reviews.Content: If you only plan on using this camera to take pictures for facebook this camera will probably meet your needs but don't expect much more.Good:* Takes AAA batteries (though on mine the battery door is hard to open)* Cheap* Relatively easy to use* Has features that upload pics to various sites for you (though I've never used these so I don't know how well they work)Bad:* The picture quality isn't great* The biggest issue for me is the fact that the screen is really awful (and pretty small) so you don't really know how the  picture turned out.* Frequently this camera focuses on the wrong things, crisp images of surrounding objects but blurry pics of the main subject.* The price is great but keep in mind that you have to buy your own SD card if you don't have one already* SD card slot isn't spring loaded so it can be a little tough to get the card out* When you put in the SD card it's really easy to slide it in crookedly which just seems odd to me.

Reviews.Title: POOR QUALITY PICTURES
Reviews.Author: SINIGH
Reviews.Content: VERY POOR QUALITY PICTURES. NO MATTER THE SETTING, ALL THE PICTURES CAME OUT BLURRY. IT HAD TO BE AN ABSOLUTE CLOSE UP IN ORDER FOR IT TO LOOK REASONABLE. IT SEEM LIKE A TOY FOR A CHILD.

Reviews.Title: horrable
Reviews.Author: ntkrkr
Reviews.Content: This camera is the worst camera I have ever owned! bought a cheaper camera until I could afford a better one after my good one was stolen. I was not expecting much but the pics are horrable I have tried several differant settings but the pics all come out either red or really grainy!

Reviews.Title: Absolute garbage....
Reviews.Author: Matt D. Wolfe
Reviews.Content: We bought one of these for our daughter for summer camp.  Our daughter kept it in a padded case and was very careful with it.  It lasted 2 weeks before breaking.  Power button didn't function, couldn't review pictures, you name it.  You get what you pay for, but this is the worst kind of Chinese made garbage.

Reviews.Title: vivtar 7022
Reviews.Author: BLB
Reviews.Content: The seller was very quick delivering the product. The camera was sealed and new after opening and putting batteries in, the camera worked fine .The flash was inoperative in all modes .How can a new product not work  right .right out of the box.

Reviews.Title: Not Satisfied
Reviews.Author: TEH
Reviews.Content: The pictures that the camera took were not clear.  I tried adjusting the settings but this did not make the pictures that I took any better.  This is why I returned the camera.

Reviews.Title: not worth it
Reviews.Author: Debra Hobart "debbie"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter and it is not worth buying. The pictures are grainy and of low quality. The only thing the camera has going for it is it's size. It fits in a pocket and is easy to use but the overall quality is seriously lacking.

Reviews.Title: Cheap and Less quality than expected
Reviews.Author: Franklin Ferreira
Reviews.Content: I was looking a cheap camera that I can waste in case of missing.  After a brief read of all review,  I decided to expend a few more dollars in a middle range Vivitar Camera. VIVITAR 7022 even being a 7M pixels, pictures are like the old first VGA wed cameras.  ***DO NOT WASTE YOU MONEY ***

Reviews.Title: junk!  do not waste your money!!
Reviews.Author: vocalconsumer
Reviews.Content: This camera was cheap, sure, but not worth one penny!!!! It is a piece of TRASH! It has no user manual, and when i looked up the user manual online, it was so ridiculously complicated! What is the point of a simple digital camera if it is not simple to use? This is a PIECE OF TRASH! It takes HORRIBLE PICTURES. It is impossible to figure out and use. Vivitar just alienated me forever. This camera is TRASH - JUNK - DO NOT BUY this awful camera - that is as clear as i can state my opinion without resorting to bad language. I tried to get this to post with ZERO stars.

ProductInfo.Features:
7.1 Megapixel CCD
4x Digital Zoom
1.8" LCD Screen
AntiShake Technology
HD Video Mode
ProductInfo.Name: Vivitar 7022 Vivicam 7.1MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom (Black)
